mosaic knitting is a method of knitting that uses slipped stitches to create a colorwork design across your work it is different from stranded colorwork in that you are not carrying the two yarns throughout a round but instead alternating what color you use every other round *you do not need to cut the color every other round just carry the color up the inside of your work - be mindful that when you go to knit a stitch after slipping stitches you don t pull your working yarn too tight which would cause the stitches to pucker - size adjustments if you would like to make the circumference of the cowl smaller or larger to fit your needs it is a 10-stitch pattern repeat so you would just adjust the amount of stitches that you cast on by 10 for example if you want a cowl with a smaller circumference you could choose to cast on 120 stitches you would follow the pattern the same just adjusting the amount of stitches that you cast on if you would like the make the length of the cowl longer i would recommend just adding 1 or more pattern repeats to achieve the length that you want or omitting a pattern repeat if you want it shorter instructions using color a co 140sts place st marker and join to work in the round bottom cuff rounds 1-12 *k3 p2 repeat from * around main body next round k around round 1 using color b *sl1 k1 sl2 k3 sl2 k1 repeat from * to end round 2 and all even rounds using current color k the k sts and sl the slipped sts as you come to them round 3 using color a *k4 sl1 k1 sl1 k3 repeat from * to end of round round 5 using color b *k1
